description.text: You butcher animals for their fresh, fresh, fresh meat. This occurs automatically in the midst of combat due to the butchering reflexes you've honed into muscle-memory, as they say.
This monster has been lured toward you!

You can call out to a particular monster and lure them toward you at will. In particular, you've mastered the Diggle mating call which is produced by squeezing ones hands together in a particular manner and waggling your fingers while blowing air through the entire mess.
Summon a Hunting Diggle.
Release the Trained Hunting Diggles!
Carve trophies for vague, grisly rewards. (In other words, you get an experience bonus when killing animals.)
The streets shall run green!
You get experience for killing vegetables, yay!
Your animal friend will fight for you because they love you sooo much. (Go animal friend, fight for me!)

You've lost your Vegan Powers because you broke Vegan Edge. You are weakened by the dark energies of meat and/or dairy and/or honey (unless you're a Beegan) until your body and spirit are properly cleansed.
You have brought shame to Vegans everywhere! Shame. This will go away eventually.
Your body is polluted by non-Vegan things! Shame. This will go away eventually.
You have learned the Vegan secret to breaking the circle of life: You can purify your body and mind through will alone.
The power of Krong compells you - get OUT demons, I saayyyy get OUT!
As the beatings continue, your morale improves.
Suffers your enemies the barbeque of The Pit!
You put your demonologist hand in, you put your demonologist hand out and shake it all about. As long as you stay IN the circle, they shouldn't be able to hurt you.
Summon a Swarmy.
Oh, the power that can be yours! Summons a pack of demonic denizens to do your bidding. (And watch out 'cause this deal is getting worse all the time.)
You are the demons.
Contaminated by the powers of darkness, the infernal flame burns your eternal soul! ... I hope it was worth it.
Rebuild your artifact in the Flames of the Heckforge.
You're a diggle!
It's the dreaded Diggle Plague! Run away and blast it with fireballs: it's the only way to be sure.
What's better than a Diggle? An invisible Diggle.
You don't want to think about what this skill actually does. At least you might get breakfast out of it.
Smash through an adjacent wall with your mighty drilling-proboscis.
Strike with the strength of the Diggle Masters! Damage scales to your Caddishness.
You've learned dirty swashbuckling tactics from your time on the seas. Allows you to counter ALL of the next few attacks against yourself.
The Mists of the Corsair serve to hide all manner of piratical activity from the eyes of authorities - and can be very useful to escape a tight spot. Can only be called upon every so often.
It's a confusing piratical mist.
For just one instant it's as if you were never there.

Whoever is marked with the Black Spot can hope only for a quick death, or the next best thing: deep-fried cheesecake on a stick. The point is the marked target is utterly doomed so watch where you point this thing.
Give 'em the broadside, me hearties! (And don't ask where the cannon is hidden.)
You can't be together any more.
The Cure will heal you, but at a terrible price that will be photographed in your school yearbook.
Contact with Emo Magicks has given you an overwhelming sense of existential malaise and an inexplicable urge to dye your hair. The effect cannot be removed by common curse removal methods.
Chemical Explosion.
Chemical Explosion. Don't breathe this.
As long as this glooming cloud persists magic in its radius will cease to be.
This sigil saps the ability to care about stuff or do anything useful. It is commonly found inscribed in the locale of those incessant bohemian youths.
Take up the mark, and be the saviour of the beaten, the broken and the damned. Or something.
Depressing. So very, VERY depressing. Anyone hit by this beam will be struck with existential despair and passivity.
Dazzles your enemies, leaving them stunned by your spooky, sparkly vampire glamour. This also saps some of their life-force. Because seriously.
And away!
Creates clouds of highly-confusing toxic spores.
Pew pew, zap!

description.text: Pew pew, zap!
description.monsterText: calls upon the holy wrath of its god!

description.text: Pew pew, zap!
description.monsterText: calls upon the apocalyptic wrath of its god!

description.text: Smash through an adjacent wall with your mighty drilling-proboscis.
Deathly death.
Rooted by potatoes! Dodging is more difficult, movement is impossible.
You know the icy, skeletal touch of the drill-like beak of the Diggle God of Death; clouds of death billow from you.
The Diggle God of War demands VICTORY!
The Diggle God of Fertility watches over you, trying to hatch you like an egg.
The Diggle God of Secrets whispers to you, in the dark, alone. It's pretty creepy.
You don't even know what happened here, but somehow you got a blessing. That's nice, I think?

digglegod.name: Diggle God of Death
digglegod.description: Dark and skeletal, the Diggle God of Death relaxes in his? stylish coffin.

digglegod.name: Diggle God of War
digglegod.description: It is a statue of the Diggle God of War! Or possibly Battyman.

digglegod.name: Diggle God of Fertility
digglegod.description: The Diggle God of Fertility gazes upon his? egg with a look of mild constipation.

digglegod.name: Diggle God of Digging
digglegod.description: The Diggle God of Digging mainly has his statues created by out-of-work visual arts students.

digglegod.name: Diggle God of Secrets
digglegod.description: Congratulations, you found a statue of the Diggle God of Secrets. Now scamper.

The spatial dimensions slide around and whorl about, unsure of where they are meant to be.
The Hunter strikes to kill.
